event: arterial ammonia was unusually elevated at 204 µmol/L
Gram stain revealed encapsulated yeast suspicious for Cryptococcus
ammonia proceeded to unexpectedly climb to 692 µmol/L
urine and bronchial aspirate was obtained for Mycoplasma and Ureaplasma polymerase chain reaction (PCR)
ammonia levels had fallen to <100 µmol/L
Cryptococcal serum and cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) antigen titers both returned positive at >1:2560
cultures from bronchoalveolar lavage, CSF, and blood all revealed cryptococcal growth
repeat lumbar punctures revealed opening pressures greater than 45 cmH2O
unable to wean from mechanical ventilation
moved to comfort care in hospice
urea cycle disorder screening studies eventually returned
normal serum citrulline and arginine level
